Package org.e2immu.annotatedapi

Class AnnotatedAPI

java.lang.Object
org.e2immu.annotatedapi.AnnotatedAPI
public class AnnotatedAPI extends Object
Helper methods used in Annotated API classes. These methods are known to the analyser in a hard-wired way; they exist to support the computation of instance state using companion methods.

  • Constructor Summary

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static boolean
    isFact​(boolean b)
    The method analyser replaces the method call isFact(clause) with the boolean value true when the clause is present in the current instance state of the object.
    static boolean
    isKnown​(boolean test)
    The method analyser replaces the method call isKnown(true) with a boolean to test if the current instance state is keeping track of clauses that represent elements added to a collection.

  • Method Details

    • isFact

      public static boolean isFact​(boolean b)
      The method analyser replaces the method call isFact(clause) with the boolean value true when the clause is present in the current instance state of the object.

      This method, hard-wired into the method analyser, is to be used in companion methods, see for example JavaUtil in the e2immu/annotatedAPI project.

      The method does not return identity; it is not modifying.

      Parameters:
      b - the clause
      Returns:
      specialised inline method

    • isKnown

      public static boolean isKnown​(boolean test)
      The method analyser replaces the method call isKnown(true) with a boolean to test if the current instance state is keeping track of clauses that represent elements added to a collection. It keeps isKnown(false) as is.

      This method, hard-wired into the method analyser, is to be used in companion methods, see for example JavaUtil in the e2immu/annotatedAPI project.

      Parameters:
      test - true when testing, false when generating a clause for the state
      Returns:
      true when absence of information means knowing the negation
